description:
Nothing about the classic Bavarian structure, rainbow-hued flower boxes, giant cuckoo clock, or towering stone viaduct indicate that the historic is anything more than a traditional space. Located in the Breitnau region of the upper Black Forest, the complex is not just a standard hotel catering to visitors wanting to explore the history and natural […]

The post This 500-year-old hotel in Germany’s Black Forest is an energy self-sufficient wonder appeared first on Popular Science.
title: This 500-year-old hotel in Germany’s Black Forest is an energy self-sufficient wonder

description:
When they aren’t yowling to be let out the front door (and immediately back in again), bringing home half-dead animals, and purring contentedly as you recover from receiving said animals, cats love few activities more than “making biscuits”.  In case you aren’t familiar, here’s a quick refresher: a “biscuit-making” cat will push its front paws […]

title: Why do cats make biscuits?
